title: Reduces the rate at which a taxpayer's entire net income base shall be computed
summary: Reduces the rate at which a taxpayer's entire net income base shall be computed for the purposes of the franchise tax on business corporations.

       AN ACT to amend the tax law, in relation to net income base

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section  1.  The  opening paragraph and subparagraphs (iv) and (vi) of
    2  paragraph (a) of subdivision 1 of section 210 of the tax law, as amended
    3  by section 2 of part N of chapter 60 of the laws of 2007, are amended to
    4  read as follows:
    5    Entire net income base. For taxable years beginning before July first,
    6  nineteen hundred ninety-nine, the amount prescribed  by  this  paragraph
    7  shall  be  computed at the rate of nine percent of the taxpayer's entire
    8  net income base. For taxable years beginning after June thirtieth, nine-
    9  teen hundred ninety-nine and before July first, two thousand, the amount
   10  prescribed by this paragraph shall be computed at the rate of eight  and
   11  one-half  percent  of the taxpayer's entire net income base. For taxable
   12  years beginning after June  thirtieth,  two  thousand  and  before  July
   13  first,  two  thousand one, the amount prescribed by this paragraph shall
   14  be computed at the rate of eight percent of the  taxpayer's  entire  net
   15  income base. For taxable years beginning after June thirtieth, two thou-
   16  sand  one  and  before  January  first,  two  thousand seven, the amount
   17  prescribed by this paragraph shall be computed at the rate of seven  and
   18  one-half  percent of the taxpayer's entire net income base.  For taxable
   19  years beginning [on or] after January  first,  two  thousand  seven  AND
   20  BEFORE JANUARY FIRST, TWO THOUSAND TWELVE, the amount prescribed by this
   21  paragraph  shall  be computed at the rate of seven and one-tenth percent
   22  of the taxpayer's entire net income base.  FOR TAXABLE  YEARS  BEGINNING

                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.

    1  ON OR AFTER JANUARY FIRST, TWO THOUSAND TWELVE, THE AMOUNT PRESCRIBED BY
    2  THIS  PARAGRAPH SHALL BE COMPUTED AT THE RATE OF SIX AND EIGHTY-FIVE ONE
    3  HUNDREDTH PERCENT OF THE TAXPAYER'S ENTIRE NET INCOME BASE. The  taxpay-
    4  er's  entire  net  income  base shall mean the portion of the taxpayer's
    5  entire net income allocated within the state  as  hereinafter  provided,
    6  subject to any modification required by paragraphs (d) and (e) of subdi-
    7  vision  three  of this section. However, in the case of a small business
    8  taxpayer, as defined in paragraph (f) of this  subdivision,  the  amount
    9  prescribed  by this paragraph shall be computed pursuant to subparagraph
   10  (iv) of this paragraph and in the case of a manufacturer, as defined  in
   11  subparagraph (vi) of this paragraph, the amount prescribed by this para-
   12  graph shall be computed pursuant to subparagraph (vi) of this paragraph.
   13    (iv)  for  taxable  years  beginning  [on or] after January first, two
   14  thousand seven AND BEFORE JANUARY FIRST, TWO  THOUSAND  TWELVE,  if  the
   15  entire  net  income  base  is  not more than two hundred ninety thousand
   16  dollars the amount shall be six and one-half percent of the  entire  net
   17  income  base;  if  the  entire  net income base is more than two hundred
   18  ninety thousand dollars but  not  over  three  hundred  ninety  thousand
   19  dollars  the  amount  shall  be  the  sum of (1) eighteen thousand eight
   20  hundred fifty dollars, (2) seven and one-tenth percent of the excess  of
   21  the  entire net income base over two hundred ninety thousand dollars but
   22  not over three hundred ninety thousand dollars and (3) four and  thirty-
   23  five hundredths percent of the excess of the entire net income base over
   24  three  hundred  fifty thousand dollars but not over three hundred ninety
   25  thousand dollars.   FOR TAXABLE YEARS  BEGINNING  ON  OR  AFTER  JANUARY
   26  FIRST,  TWO  THOUSAND TWELVE, IF THE ENTIRE NET INCOME IS NOT OVER THREE
   27  HUNDRED NINETY THOUSAND DOLLARS THE AMOUNT SHALL BE SIX PERCENT  OF  THE
   28  ENTIRE NET INCOME BASE;
   29    (vi)  for  taxable years beginning [on or] after January thirty-first,
   30  two thousand seven AND BEFORE JANUARY FIRST, TWO  THOUSAND  TWELVE,  the
   31  amount  prescribed by this paragraph for a taxpayer which is a qualified
   32  New York manufacturer, shall be computed at the rate of six and one-half
   33  (6.5) percent of the taxpayer's entire net income  base.    FOR  TAXABLE
   34  YEARS  BEGINNING  ON  OR  AFTER  JANUARY FIRST, TWO THOUSAND TWELVE, THE
   35  AMOUNT PRESCRIBED BY THIS PARAGRAPH SHALL BE COMPUTED AT THE RATE OF SIX
   36  PERCENT OF THE TAXPAYER'S ENTIRE NET INCOME BASE. The term  "manufactur-
   37  er"  shall  mean a taxpayer which during the taxable year is principally
   38  engaged in the production of goods by manufacturing, processing,  assem-
   39  bling, refining, mining, extracting, farming, agriculture, horticulture,
   40  floriculture,  viticulture  or commercial fishing.   However, the gener-
   41  ation and distribution of electricity, the distribution of natural  gas,
   42  and  the production of steam associated with the generation of electric-
   43  ity shall not be qualifying activities for  a  manufacturer  under  this
   44  subparagraph.    Moreover,  the  combined  group  shall  be considered a
   45  "manufacturer" for purposes of this subparagraph only  if  the  combined
   46  group  during  the taxable year is principally engaged in the activities
   47  set forth in this paragraph, or any combination thereof. A taxpayer or a
   48  combined group shall be "principally engaged"  in  activities  described
   49  above  if, during the taxable year, more than fifty percent of the gross
   50  receipts of the taxpayer or combined group,  respectively,  are  derived
   51  from  receipts  from  the  sale of goods produced by such activities. In
   52  computing a combined group's  gross  receipts,  intercorporate  receipts
   53  shall  be eliminated.  A "qualified New York manufacturer" is a manufac-
   54  turer which has property in New York which is described in clause (A) of
   55  subparagraph (i) of paragraph (b) of subdivision twelve of this  section
   56  and  either  (I)  the adjusted basis of such property for federal income

    1  tax purposes at the close of the taxable year is at  least  one  million
    2  dollars  or (II) all of its real and personal property is located in New
    3  York. In addition, a "qualified New York manufacturer" means a  taxpayer
    4  which  is defined as a qualified emerging technology company under para-
    5  graph (c) of subdivision one of section thirty-one hundred two-e of  the
    6  public  authorities  law regardless of the ten million dollar limitation
    7  expressed in subparagraph one of such paragraph (c).
    8    S 2. This act shall take effect immediately.
